org.pepstock.charba.client.utils.toast

Class ToastItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pepstock.charba.client.commons.NativeObjectContainer
      • org.pepstock.charba.client.commons.AbstractNode
        • org.pepstock.charba.client.utils.toast.ToastItem

  • public final class ToastItem
extends AbstractNode
    Represents an toast instance, once it has been created and consumed, by Toaster.show(ToastOptions).
    Author:
    Andrea "Stock" Stocchero

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getBorderRadius()
      Returns the border radius (in pixels).
      Date getCloseDateTime()
      Returns the date time when the toast item has been closed.
      Div getElement()
      Returns the Div element which represents the toast in the DOM.
      Img getIcon()
      Returns the icon image set for toast.
      int getId()
      Returns the unique id of toast item.
      org.pepstock.charba.client.utils.toast.IsDefaultContentElement getLabel()
      Returns the label of the toast.
      Date getOpenDateTime()
      Returns the date time when the toast item has been opened.
      IsProgressBarType getProgressBarType()
      Returns the type of the toast progress bar.
      Date getQueueDateTime()
      Returns the date time when the toast item has been put in the queue.
      default String getText()
      Returns the text of the toast.
      int getTimeout()
      Returns how long the toast notification should last.
      org.pepstock.charba.client.utils.toast.IsDefaultContentElement getTitle()
      Returns the title of the toast.
      IsToastType getType()
      Returns the type of the toast.
      boolean isAutoHide()
      Returns whether to make the toast notification sticky, which means that the toast notification will never auto dismiss until clicked.
      boolean isHideProgressBar()
      Returns true whether to hide the progress bar.
      boolean isHideShadow()
      Returns true whether to hide the shadow of toast.
      boolean isShowing()
      Returns true if the toast item is still shown, otherwise false.
      boolean show()
      Creates and shows a toast configured by this toast item.
      String toString()
